question: Determine the developers that had the most unfixed bugs?
response: The developer with the most unfixed bugs is XhmikosR, with a total of 10 unfixed bugs.
query:
cypher
MATCH (u:User)-[:creates]->(i:Issue)-[:belongs_to]->(r:Repository)
WHERE i.state <> 'closed'
RETURN u.name AS developer, COUNT(i) AS unfixed_bugs
ORDER BY unfixed_bugs DESC
LIMIT 1

question: Determine the bug(s) that were introduced because of commit hash 9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39?
response: The bug introduced because of commit hash 9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39 is titled "iPad modal `<select>` bug". The issue number is 14975, and it was created on 2014-11-03. The issue describes a problem where, when popping up a modal on a scrolled-down page and then opening a `<select>` within the modal, the page jumps up, causing misalignment of elements within the modal. This issue was closed on 2015-10-13. More details can be found at the URL: [https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/14975](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/14975).

i.body:
"When popping up a modal on a page that is scrolled down, then opening a `<select>` within the modal, the page jumps up. All elements on the modal are shifted in a way that they no longer line up with the actual visuals. Its tough to explain, so I put together a demo:

https://github.com/CaptSaltyJack/bootstrap-select-bug

Once its broken and the modal button and dropdown no longer work, try tapping slightly above them. Youll see what I mean about the touch areas being displaced. Once you scroll to the top of the page, the modal elements work again as expected.
"
i.title: "iPad modal <select> bug"

question: what are the bugs caused by commit f0c82ab4ec8ca136dad1b50bdef7515090be4f14?
response: The commit `f0c82ab4ec8ca136dad1b50bdef7515090be4f14` introduced the bug described in Issue #25195. The issue is titled "Amend the 'sticky `:hover`/`:focus`' section, deprecate `hover` mixin" and details problems with the behavior of `:hover` styles on touchscreens, particularly on iOS/Safari. The issue highlights that `:hover` styles remain applied under certain conditions on these platforms, causing other styles like `:focus` and `:active` to be ignored. The workaround mentioned in the documentation is currently non-functional, and the issue suggests removing the mention of it and properly deprecating the `hover` mixin. The full details of the issue can be found [here](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/25195).
query:
cypher
MATCH (c:Commit {id: 'f0c82ab4ec8ca136dad1b50bdef7515090be4f14'})-[:introduced]->(i:Issue)
RETURN i

i.body:
"On https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/getting-started/browsers-devices/#sticky-hoverfocus-on-mobile it says

> Even though real hovering isn’t possible on most touchscreens, most mobile browsers emulate hovering support and make `:hover` “sticky”. In other words, `:hover` styles start applying after tapping an element and only stop applying after the user taps some other element.

This is not completely correct. Currently, it seems that only iOS/Safari (and other iOS browsers using WebKit) has issues with sticky `:hover` under certain conditions. Seems limited to links, buttons. Here, `:hover` style remains applied, and other styles like `:focus` and `:active` are ignored. `:focus` does "stick" in all mobile browsers, even in iOS for controls like "faked" `<span ...>` based buttons or similar.

The prose itself, if we want to keep it, would need some rejigging, making it clear that `:hover` stickyness is an iOS/Safari only problem.

The workaround mentioned - relating to the `hover` mixin, is currently commented out and non-working. We should just remove mention of it (perhaps include some other advice, or just that were not doing anything special here to prevent this sticking at this stage). And deprecate the mixin properly (@mdo mentioned "`@include hover { }` just returns a normal `:hover`?").

Related: https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/25182

Hoping that for 4.1 we can experiment with using the upcoming `:focus-visible` https://drafts.csswg.org/selectors-4/#the-focusring-pseudo pseudo-class with polyfill, to fix sticky `:focus` as a result of touch (and mouse). And that hopefully we can find an iOS/Safari specific hack or workaround to fix the sticky `:hover` that occurs in certain situations just on this platform."
i.title: "Amend the "sticky `:hover`/`:focus`" section, deprecate `hover` mixin"

question: Determine the percentage of the fixing commits that introduced bugs on December 2013?
response: The percentage of fixing commits that introduced bugs in December 2013 is approximately 2.04%. Can I help with anything else?
query:
cypher
MATCH (c:Commit)-[:introduced]->(:Issue)
WHERE c.committedDate =~ '2013-12-.*'
WITH count(c) AS introducedBugs
MATCH (c:Commit)-[:fixed]->(:Issue)
WHERE c.committedDate =~ '2013-12-.*'
WITH introducedBugs, count(c) AS fixingCommits
RETURN (toFloat(introducedBugs) / fixingCommits) * 100 AS percentage

question: Determine the bug(s) that were introduced because of commit hash 9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39?
response:
The bug that was introduced because of commit hash 9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39 is titled "iPad modal <select> bug". The issue was created on 2014-11-03T10:05:30Z and was closed on 2015-10-13T02:13:32Z. The issue description is as follows:

"When popping up a modal on a page that is scrolled down, then opening a `<select>` within the modal, the page jumps up. All elements on the modal are shifted in a way that they no longer line up with the actual visuals. It's tough to explain, so I put together a demo:

https://github.com/CaptSaltyJack/bootstrap-select-bug

Once it's broken and the modal button and dropdown no longer work, try tapping slightly above them. You'll see what I mean about the touch areas being displaced. Once you scroll to the top of the page, the modal elements work again as expected."

For more details, you can visit the issue URL: [https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/14975](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/14975).
query:
cypher
MATCH (c:Commit {id: '9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39'})-[:introduced]->(i:Issue)
RETURN i

i.body:
"When popping up a modal on a page that is scrolled down, then opening a `<select>` within the modal, the page jumps up. All elements on the modal are shifted in a way that they no longer line up with the actual visuals. Its tough to explain, so I put together a demo:

https://github.com/CaptSaltyJack/bootstrap-select-bug

Once its broken and the modal button and dropdown no longer work, try tapping slightly above them. Youll see what I mean about the touch areas being displaced. Once you scroll to the top of the page, the modal elements work again as expected.
"
i.title: "iPad modal <select> bug"

query:

MATCH (u:User)-[:author]->(c:Commit)-[:introduced]->(i:Issue)

RETURN u.name AS developer, COUNT(i) AS unfixed_bugs
ORDER BY unfixed_bugs DESC
LIMIT 1

question: Determine the bug(s) that were introduced because of commit hash 9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39?
response: The bug that was introduced because of commit hash 9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39 is an issue titled "iPad modal `<select>` bug". This issue was created on 2014-11-03T10:05:30Z and closed on 2015-10-13T02:13:32Z. The problem described in the issue is that when popping up a modal on a page that is scrolled down, then opening a `<select>` within the modal, the page jumps up, causing modal elements to be misaligned visually. The issue can be further explored at the following URL: [https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/14975](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/14975).
query:
cypher
MATCH (c:Commit {id: '9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39'})-[:introduced]->(i:Issue)
RETURN i

i.body:
"When popping up a modal on a page that is scrolled down, then opening a `<select>` within the modal, the page jumps up. All elements on the modal are shifted in a way that they no longer line up with the actual visuals. Its tough to explain, so I put together a demo:

https://github.com/CaptSaltyJack/bootstrap-select-bug

Once its broken and the modal button and dropdown no longer work, try tapping slightly above them. Youll see what I mean about the touch areas being displaced. Once you scroll to the top of the page, the modal elements work again as expected.
"
i.title: "iPad modal <select> bug"

question: Determine the bug(s) that were introduced because of commit hash 9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39?
response:
The bug introduced because of the commit hash `9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39` is titled "iPad modal `<select>` bug". The issue was created on 2014-11-03 and closed on 2015-10-13. The problem described is: 

"When popping up a modal on a page that is scrolled down, then opening a `<select>` within the modal, the page jumps up. All elements on the modal are shifted in a way that they no longer line up with the actual visuals. It's tough to explain, so I put together a demo: [Demo Link](https://github.com/CaptSaltyJack/bootstrap-select-bug). Once it's broken and the modal button and dropdown no longer work, try tapping slightly above them. You'll see what I mean about the touch areas being displaced. Once you scroll to the top of the page, the modal elements work again as expected."

For more details, you can refer to the issue on GitHub [here](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/14975).
query:
cypher
MATCH (c:Commit {id: '9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39'})-[:introduced]->(i:Issue)
RETURN i

"When popping up a modal on a page that is scrolled down, then opening a `<select>` within the modal, the page jumps up. All elements on the modal are shifted in a way that they no longer line up with the actual visuals. Its tough to explain, so I put together a demo:

https://github.com/CaptSaltyJack/bootstrap-select-bug

Once its broken and the modal button and dropdown no longer work, try tapping slightly above them. Youll see what I mean about the touch areas being displaced. Once you scroll to the top of the page, the modal elements work again as expected.
"
i.title: "iPad modal <select> bug"

question: what are the bugs caused by commit f0c82ab4ec8ca136dad1b50bdef7515090be4f14?
response: The bug caused by commit f0c82ab4ec8ca136dad1b50bdef7515090be4f14 is related to the "sticky `:hover`/`:focus`" section and the deprecation of the `hover` mixin. The issue is described in detail in the following URL: [https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/25195](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/25195). The issue was created on 2018-01-04 and closed on 2018-01-11. The problem involves incorrect behavior of `:hover` styles on iOS/Safari browsers, where `:hover` styles remain applied under certain conditions, and other styles like `:focus` and `:active` are ignored.
query:
cypher
MATCH (c:Commit {id: 'f0c82ab4ec8ca136dad1b50bdef7515090be4f14'})-[:introduced]->(i:Issue)
RETURN i

i.body:
"On https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/getting-started/browsers-devices/#sticky-hoverfocus-on-mobile it says

> Even though real hovering isn’t possible on most touchscreens, most mobile browsers emulate hovering support and make `:hover` “sticky”. In other words, `:hover` styles start applying after tapping an element and only stop applying after the user taps some other element.

This is not completely correct. Currently, it seems that only iOS/Safari (and other iOS browsers using WebKit) has issues with sticky `:hover` under certain conditions. Seems limited to links, buttons. Here, `:hover` style remains applied, and other styles like `:focus` and `:active` are ignored. `:focus` does "stick" in all mobile browsers, even in iOS for controls like "faked" `<span ...>` based buttons or similar.

The prose itself, if we want to keep it, would need some rejigging, making it clear that `:hover` stickyness is an iOS/Safari only problem.

The workaround mentioned - relating to the `hover` mixin, is currently commented out and non-working. We should just remove mention of it (perhaps include some other advice, or just that were not doing anything special here to prevent this sticking at this stage). And deprecate the mixin properly (@mdo mentioned "`@include hover { }` just returns a normal `:hover`?").

Related: https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/25182

Hoping that for 4.1 we can experiment with using the upcoming `:focus-visible` https://drafts.csswg.org/selectors-4/#the-focusring-pseudo pseudo-class with polyfill, to fix sticky `:focus` as a result of touch (and mouse). And that hopefully we can find an iOS/Safari specific hack or workaround to fix the sticky `:hover` that occurs in certain situations just on this platform."
i.title: "Amend the "sticky `:hover`/`:focus`" section, deprecate `hover` mixin"

question: Determine the bug(s) that were introduced because of commit hash 9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39?
response: The bug introduced because of commit hash 9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39 is described in Issue #14975. The issue, titled "iPad modal `<select>` bug," was created on 2014-11-03 and closed on 2015-10-13. The problem occurs when popping up a modal on a scrolled-down page and then opening a `<select>` within the modal, causing the page to jump up. This results in the modal elements being misaligned with the visuals, making them unresponsive. More details and a demo can be found [here](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/14975).
query:
cypher
MATCH (c:Commit {id: '9a3d72f659669e20ccff8baa4426fe0f24413a39'})-[:introduced]->(i:Issue)
RETURN i

i.body:
"When popping up a modal on a page that is scrolled down, then opening a `<select>` within the modal, the page jumps up. All elements on the modal are shifted in a way that they no longer line up with the actual visuals. Its tough to explain, so I put together a demo:

https://github.com/CaptSaltyJack/bootstrap-select-bug

Once its broken and the modal button and dropdown no longer work, try tapping slightly above them. Youll see what I mean about the touch areas being displaced. Once you scroll to the top of the page, the modal elements work again as expected.
"
i.title: "iPad modal <select> bug"

question: what are the bugs caused by commit f0c82ab4ec8ca136dad1b50bdef7515090be4f14?
response: The commit `f0c82ab4ec8ca136dad1b50bdef7515090be4f14` introduced the issue titled "Amend the 'sticky `:hover`/`:focus`' section, deprecate `hover` mixin". The issue, numbered 25195, was created on January 4, 2018, and closed on January 11, 2018. It addresses inaccuracies in documentation about the behavior of `:hover` and `:focus` on mobile devices, particularly noting that the `:hover` stickiness is primarily an issue with iOS/Safari. The issue also discusses the deprecation of the `hover` mixin and suggests possible future improvements using the `:focus-visible` pseudo-class to address sticky `:focus` issues. The full details can be found at [this link](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/25195).
query:
cypher
MATCH (c:Commit {id: 'f0c82ab4ec8ca136dad1b50bdef7515090be4f14'})-[:introduced]->(i:Issue)
RETURN i

i.body:
"On https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/getting-started/browsers-devices/#sticky-hoverfocus-on-mobile it says

> Even though real hovering isn’t possible on most touchscreens, most mobile browsers emulate hovering support and make `:hover` “sticky”. In other words, `:hover` styles start applying after tapping an element and only stop applying after the user taps some other element.

This is not completely correct. Currently, it seems that only iOS/Safari (and other iOS browsers using WebKit) has issues with sticky `:hover` under certain conditions. Seems limited to links, buttons. Here, `:hover` style remains applied, and other styles like `:focus` and `:active` are ignored. `:focus` does "stick" in all mobile browsers, even in iOS for controls like "faked" `<span ...>` based buttons or similar.

The prose itself, if we want to keep it, would need some rejigging, making it clear that `:hover` stickyness is an iOS/Safari only problem.

The workaround mentioned - relating to the `hover` mixin, is currently commented out and non-working. We should just remove mention of it (perhaps include some other advice, or just that were not doing anything special here to prevent this sticking at this stage). And deprecate the mixin properly (@mdo mentioned "`@include hover { }` just returns a normal `:hover`?").

Related: https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/25182

Hoping that for 4.1 we can experiment with using the upcoming `:focus-visible` https://drafts.csswg.org/selectors-4/#the-focusring-pseudo pseudo-class with polyfill, to fix sticky `:focus` as a result of touch (and mouse). And that hopefully we can find an iOS/Safari specific hack or workaround to fix the sticky `:hover` that occurs in certain situations just on this platform."
i.title: "Amend the "sticky `:hover`/`:focus`" section, deprecate `hover` mixin"
